definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Though perhaps that's what many privacy advocates fear most.
sentences.chinese: 然而這也許正是很多隱私保護提倡者最擔心的事。

sentences.english: In the college, the professor he met first was an advocate of truth.
sentences.chinese: 在學院裏，他最先遇到的教授是一個真理的提倡者。

sentences.english: Feng Zikai was a warmhearted advocator of the popular literature and arts.
sentences.chinese: 豐子愷是一個大衆文藝的熱心提倡者。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo is the modem education thought initiator and the success practice.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若是現代教育思想的提倡者和成功的踐行者。

sentences.english: Wine Advocate calls the wine "a solid value from Napa Valley."
sentences.chinese: 《葡萄酒提倡者》稱其代表了“納帕谷的堅實品質。

definition: to advocate/to initiate/to propose/to be a proponent of (an idea or school of thought)
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
reformism (i.e. favoring gradual change as opposed to revolution)

pinyin: zi4 you2 yi4 zhi4 zhu3 yi4
